Class ScoreLoop

java.lang.Object
ScoreLoop
public final class ScoreLoop
extends java.lang.Object
This final class has only a no argument constructor, 4 private methods, 3 private final variables and 3 private variables. There is no reason for this class to be extended.
Author:
Max Finch

  • Field Details

    • sc

      private final java.util.Scanner sc
      Scanner object used to read all user input

    • finalGameOption

      private final int finalGameOption
      When the user chooses the game to score it is assigned to finalGameOption and the option CANNOT be changed.

    • notFinalGameOption

      private int notFinalGameOption
      When the user chooses the game to score this variable stores the selection that was set in validInput() (called in mainMenuScreen). Because the different printing components are separated for sake of organization, we cannot assign finalGameOption with notFinalGameOption directly.

    • homeTeam

      private java.lang.String homeTeam
      Holds the home team name. This variable is not final because like notFinalGameOption it is assigned outside the constructor.

    • awayTeam

      private java.lang.String awayTeam
      Holds the away team name. This variable is not final because like notFinalGameOption it is assigned outside the constructor.

    • game

      private final Game game
      Keeps hold of the Game type that the user selects. This variable IS FINAL because there is no need to change the type of game mid-match.

  • Constructor Details

    • ScoreLoop

      public ScoreLoop()
      No argument constructor. Launches the menu screen, selects and starts the game loop.

  • Method Details

    • mainMenuScreen

      private void mainMenuScreen()
      This method displays the main menu. It uses validInput() to verify each option selected (In this case: game type, home team, away team)

    • validInput

      private void validInput​(int inputType)
      validInput handles three types of input: Input type 1: Game selection validation Input type 2: Team name validation Input type 3: In-Game choice validation
      Parameters:
      inputType - type of selection being made

    • selectGameLoop

      private Game selectGameLoop​(int gameOption)
      Selects the game to start. Assigns ScoreLoop's Game variable to the selected gameOption. The different cases for gameOption correspond to the print statements in mainMenuScreen()
      Parameters:
      gameOption - index of the type of game to be scored
      Returns:
      selected Game object

    • gameLoop

      private void gameLoop()
      This method displays ANY type of game. No code here is game specific. Displays the current score of the game, current game "period", scoring options for both teams and period ending for the game. This method will take user input until the last "period" for the selected game type reaches its end. It will then decide the winner and print a replay of every score each team made in each "period" If there is a tie the method will check if the selected game allows overtime. If the Game goes into overtime it will run until the Game's specific rules say it should end. (First to score, another inning, etc.). When it ends the replay will be shown. If there is a tie and overtime is NOT allowed. The Game will end as a tie and the replay will be shown.
